33. Similarly, the eyes, which love to wander
in all the beauty of Picturaâ€™s court
seek many places enjoy themselves,
wherever their desire for pleasure is guided,
hungering to see more below and above,
like finicky guests, trying everything:
for the Graces delight in
the artistic uses of variety.
right-middleAs many various things are well painted, is a delight to see.

34. Yet some Histories in particular
ought to be simpler than others,
still others are more skillfully composed:
one should work like a merchant
who artfully displays his goods
on high shelves, at the sides and below;
so one should compose the History with some onlookers,
on hills, trees, or stone steps.
right-middleOn arranging figures high and low.

35. Or holding on to columns of the architecture,
as well as others in front, on the ground below.
Further, it gives the History a fine radiance
to include many different faces,
as the noblest part of the body,
as is seen in the manner of the world,
and to create the most pleasing and diverting
presentation; and this shall not do badly.
right-middleOn including many faces in the work Tronien

36. The noble figures should stand out,
standing tall or sitting raised
above the rest: and those who address them
should humbly show obedience,
in a lower place, and dispirited.
Thus with all our characters: they should be
placed on all sides, to perform
their actions like fine actors.
right-middleOn elevating the noble figures, and making the others downcast.

37. Thus these figures should perform gracefully while
walking, standing, striding, courting, playing, or dancing;
in fear, in awe, in mourning;
displaying the meaning of the story with their gestures:
in sum, all the expressions of affections
Poses, reflections<, manifestations,
whatever matters to our art, must at the same time
be employed in the History.
right-middleIn the History, everything our Art embraces or understands will be employed.

38. The History will have no small ornament,
if one of the figures is turned
toward the people in such a way
that he wishes, with a guiding gesture
compassionately to explain a sad thing
or something terrible about to happen,
he soon infuses the viewers Gemaals
right-middleOn making a figure who appears to address people and to indicate something unfortunate happening.
